pr_title: SAK-43324 - T&Q - Inconsistent display of tab options in Scores screens

timeline.message: SAK-43324 - T&Q - Inconsistent display of tab options in Scores screens

timeline.bodyText: can you add this class via JSF attribute?
timeline.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText:
You got me!
I tried many ways, via includes and via beans, didn't find a way to do it without using facelets :( That's why I used Javascript. Do you know a way to do it via pure mojarra JSF?
replies.author: mpellicer

replies.bodyText: it's not just a simple styleClass?
replies.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText:
The problem is that the JSF template should tell the JSF menu template which tab is the current one, and the "include" directive we're using doesn't allow parameters. That's why I added a JS snippet to apply the current class to the tab, the template tells the menu where the user is.
If you know an alternative approach I'll be glad to apply it!
Thanks for the review @ottenhoff
replies.author: mpellicer
